title: Volcanic Landmarks Quiz
description: Explore the world's most famous volcanoes and volcanic landscapes with this fiery geography quiz.

questions.question: Mount Vesuvius, which destroyed Pompeii in 79 AD, overlooks which modern Italian city?
Mount Etna, one of the world's most active volcanoes, is located on which Mediterranean island?
Krakatoa (Krakatau), known for its catastrophic 1883 eruption, is located between Java and Sumatra in which country?
Mount St. Helens, which erupted dramatically in 1980, is located in which US state?
The Yellowstone Caldera, one of the world's largest supervolcanoes, is located primarily in which US state?
Mount Pinatubo, whose 1991 eruption was the second-largest of the 20th century, is located in which country?
Eyjafjallajökull, the Icelandic volcano whose 2010 eruption disrupted European air travel, is covered by what?
Mauna Loa in Hawaii is the world's largest what type of volcano?
Cotopaxi, one of the highest active volcanoes in the world, is located in which South American country?
Mount Erebus is the southernmost active volcano on Earth. On which continent is it located?
The Giant's Causeway in Northern Ireland, with its interlocking basalt columns, was formed by what volcanic process?
Stromboli, a volcano that has been erupting almost continuously for over 2,000 years, is located in which island chain?
Santorini in Greece is actually the remains of what volcanic event that occurred around 1600 BC?
Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania has three volcanic cones. Which is the highest and youngest?
The Cappadocia region of Turkey, famous for its fairy chimneys and cave dwellings, was formed by eruptions from which volcanoes?
